source_sentence: 如是我聞：一時世尊在舍衛國，祇樹林給孤獨園，與大苾芻眾俱。
translation: Thus I have heard. One time the World-honored One was staying at Sāvatthī, in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Park, accompanied by a large assembly of monks.

source_sentence: 是時有一天子，名嗟襪曩法，天報將盡，唯餘七日，而乃先現五衰之相，
translation: At that time a celestial being named Kauṇḍinya, who was famed for his condemnation of the sow law, was about to exhaust his heavenly rewards. For seven days only, but then he manifested the five signs of decay first.

source_sentence: 身無威德，垢穢旋生，頭上花鬘，咸悉萎萃，諸身分中臭氣而出，兩腋之下悉皆汗流。
translation: Their bodies lack authoritative qualities, and dirt and filth grow back and forth; the hair on their heads are covered with blossoms that all wither. A foulsmelling odor emanates from within their bodies, and sweat flows downward under their armpits.

translation: When some other celestial beings saw this, they went to Indra and said, Lord of the gods!

translation: Lord of gods, when I saw this, my heart was so grieved that I came to confess it.

source_sentence: 爾時帝釋天主，心悲愍故，往嗟韈曩法所，而告之言：「天子！
translation: At that point, Indra the lord of the gods, out of pity and compassion, went to the place where he admired the Dharma and told him, Son of God!

source_sentence: 云何而汝賢者宛轉於地，悲哀啼泣，說諸苦事，傷動見者？」
translation: How did you, good man, just turn to the ground, weep and wail in sorrow, speak of painful things that hurt those who see them?

source_sentence: 時嗟襪曩法，忽聞是語，從地而起，整服肅容，合掌而立，白帝釋言：「天主！
translation: Suddenly hearing these words, he rose from the earth and, dressed in his proper posture, stood with joined palms and said to Śakra, lord of gods!

source_sentence: 我今壽命唯餘七日。
translation: 'Now, my life span is only seven days away.

source_sentence: 命終之後，墮閻浮提王舍大城，以宿業故而受猪身。
translation: After his death, he fell into the great city of Rājagṛha in Jambudvīpa and received the body of a pig because of his past actions.

source_sentence: 天主，既受彼身，於多年中，食噉糞穢，我觀此苦，是故愁憂。」
translation: The lord of the gods, having received that body for many years, ate crude dung and defilement, and I've observed this pain; therefore, I'm sad.

source_sentence: 爾時帝釋天主，聞是語已，心甚悲愍，告嗟襪曩法天子言：「賢者，汝可誠心歸命三寶。
translation: After hearing these words, the lord of the Śakra Devānām-Indra gods was overcome with great compassion and said to the Dharma deity Kauṇḍinya, Good man, you must sincerely return your life to the Three Treasures.

source_sentence: 應作是言：『歸依佛兩足尊，歸依法離欲尊，歸依僧眾中尊。』」
translation: You should say, 'Rely on the two-legged honored one of the Buddha, the honored one who relies on the Dharma and freedom from desire, and the honored one among the saṃgha.'

source_sentence: 時彼嗟襪曩法天子，以死怖故，畏傍生故，白帝釋言：「憍尸迦！
translation: Because he was terrified of death and afraid of being an animal, the god Śakra Devānām-Indra said to Indra, Kauśika!

source_sentence: 我今歸依佛兩足尊，歸依法離欲尊，歸依僧眾中尊。」
translation: Now, I take refuge in the Buddha, the two-legged honored one, the honored one who's free of desire based on the Dharma, and the honored one among the saṃgha.

source_sentence: 時彼天子，受三歸已，心不間斷，以至命終。
translation: After accepting the three refuges, that celestial son's mind isn't interrupted until his life ends.

source_sentence: 諸天之法，下智有見，不能觀上。
translation: The dharmas of the gods are inferior in wisdom and have views, so they can't look upward.

source_sentence: 時帝釋天主，觀彼天子，生於何處，為生南閻浮提王舍大城受猪身耶？
translation: Śakra Devānām-Indra, the lord of the gods, then observed where that celestial child was born, so that he would be born in the great city of Rājagṛha in southern Jambudvīpa and receive the body of a pig?

source_sentence: 為不受猪身？
translation: Why doesn't he accept the body of a pig?

source_sentence: 盡彼天眼，觀之不見。
translation: When their divine eyes are exhausted, they don't see it.

source_sentence: 又觀傍生鬼界，亦復不見；
translation: He also observed the realm of animals and ghosts but could not see them.

source_sentence: 又觀娑訶世界人間，亦復不見；
translation: He also observed the people of the sahā world but did not see them there.

source_sentence: 乃至四大王眾天，及忉利天，盡彼觀察，都不能見。
translation: Even the great deities of the four great kings, as well as the Trāyastriṃśa gods observed them all but could not see them.

source_sentence: 爾時帝釋天主，既不見已，心生疑慮。
translation: After he didn't see him, Indra the lord of the gods had doubts in his mind.

source_sentence: 於是帝釋往祇樹林，詣世尊所，頂禮佛足，退坐一面，白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Indra then went to the Jetavana grove, went to the Bhagavān, bowed his head at his feet, withdrew to one side, and said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 彼嗟襪曩法天子，五衰現前，命在七日，宛轉在地，悲哀啼泣，說諸苦事，
translation: When the five degeneracies appeared before him, his life span was seven days. He remained motionless on the ground for seven days and cried in distress, saying these words of sorrow.

source_sentence: 傷動見者。
translation: He's hurtful to those who see.

source_sentence: 我時到彼，見此事已，而問之言：『云何賢者，悲啼懊惱，憔悴若此？』
translation: When I arrived there, I saw this and asked him about it, saying, 'How is it that you, good man, are so sad and distressed and emaciated like this?'

source_sentence: 時嗟襪曩法，而告我言：『我今壽命，唯餘七日。
translation: He then admired the soap and told me, 'Now, I have only seven days left in my life.

source_sentence: 命終之後，墮閻浮提，生王舍城，而受猪身，於多年中以諸糞穢而為食噉。』
translation: After his death, he fell into Jambudvīpa and was born in the city of Rājagṛha, where he received the body of a pig and spent many years feeding it with dung and dirt.'

source_sentence: 我聞此說，心極悲愍，乃告之言：『今汝賢者，欲脫斯苦，當歸命三寶。
translation: Having heard these words, I felt great compassion and said to him: O venerable one, if you wish to extricate yourself from this painful condition, you must take refuge in the Three Treasures.

source_sentence: 作如是言：「歸依佛兩足尊，歸依法離欲尊，歸依僧眾中尊。」』
translation: He said, Rely on the two-legged honored one of the Buddha, the honored one who relies on the Dharma and freedom from desire, and the honored one among the saṃgha.

source_sentence: 時嗟襪曩法，以死怖故，畏傍生故，而白我言：『我今歸依佛兩足尊，
translation: At that time, out of contempt for the sow-and-snake doctrine, fearful of death and terrified by fear of animals, he said to me, “I now take refuge in the Buddha, the Two-Footed Honorable One.

source_sentence: 歸依法離欲尊，歸依僧眾中尊。』
translation: They take refuge in the Dharma as the honored one who's free of desire, and they take refuge in the honored one among the saṃgha.'

source_sentence: 時嗟襪曩法，受三歸竟，而後命終。
translation: At the time, he admired the soap stick teaching and accepted the Three Refuges, but then died.

source_sentence: 世尊，我今不知，彼嗟襪曩法，託生何處？」
translation: Bhagavān, I don't know where they disparage the soap stick teaching and are entrusted with birth?

source_sentence: 爾時世尊，以正遍知，告帝釋言：「憍尸迦！
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān, with correct pervasive knowing, addressed Indra, saying, Kauśika!

source_sentence: 今嗟襪曩法天子，已生覩史多天，受五欲樂。」
translation: Now, I'm saddened that the soap-and-mouth Dharma deity has been born in the Tuṣita Heaven and experiences the pleasures of the five desires.

source_sentence: 爾時帝釋天主，聞佛語已，歡喜踊躍，心意快然，諸根圓滿。
translation: After hearing the Buddha's words, Indra, the lord of the gods, rejoiced and jumped for joy. His mind was blissful, his faculties perfected.

source_sentence: 「若歸依於佛，　　彼不墮惡道，
translation: “If someone relies on the Buddha, they won’t fall into a bad path.

source_sentence: 棄捨人身已，　　當獲得天身；
translation: Having abandoned the human body, They will attain heavenly bodies.

source_sentence: 若歸依於法，　　彼不墮惡道，
translation: If someone relies on the Dharma, they won’t fall into a bad path.

source_sentence: 棄捨人身已，　　當獲得天身；
translation: Having abandoned the human body, They will attain heavenly bodies.

source_sentence: 若歸依於僧，　　彼不墮惡道，
translation: If someone relies on the saṃgha, they won't fall into a bad path.

source_sentence: 棄捨人身已，　　當獲得天身。」
translation: After abandoning the human body, he'll attain the heavenly body.

source_sentence: 「誠心歸命佛，　　彼人當所得，
translation: I sincerely dedicate my mind to the Buddha, Who will attain it.

source_sentence: 若晝若夜中，　　佛心常憶念；
translation: Day and night, the Buddha always remembers them in his mind.

source_sentence: 誠心歸命法，　　彼人當所得，
translation: The Dharma of sincere dedication of mind and life, which they will attain,

source_sentence: 若晝若夜中，　　法力常加持；
translation: Throughout the day and night, The power of the Teaching always empowers them.

source_sentence: 誠心歸命僧，　　彼人當所得，
translation: With sincere faith, you should pay homage to the saṃgha, for whom you will attain it.

source_sentence: 若晝若夜中，　　僧威常覆護。」
translation: Whether during the day or at night, the saṃgha always protects them with authority.

source_sentence: 即於佛前，說伽陀曰：復說伽陀曰：爾時帝釋天主說伽陀已，世尊印言：「如是如是。
translation: Before the Buddha, he said to Gadha, Again, he said to Gadha, After explaining it to him, the lord of Tīrṣadeva explained it to him, and the Bhagavān replied, So it is.

source_sentence: 「歸命佛法僧，　　定不墮惡道；
translation: Taking refuge in the Buddha, Dharma, and Sangha, They will surely not fall into evil states.

source_sentence: 棄捨人身已，　　當獲得天身。」
translation: After abandoning the human body, he'll attain the heavenly body.

source_sentence: 「若佛陀二字，　　得到於舌上，
translation: “Suppose the two words ‘Buddha’ and ‘Buddha’ are found on the tongue.

source_sentence: 同彼歸命等，　　不虛過一生；
translation: They are the same as those who take refuge in sentient beings and so forth, And do not lie beyond one lifetime.

source_sentence: 若達磨二字，　　得到於舌上，
translation: If the two words dharma and dharma are found on the tongue,

source_sentence: 同彼歸命等，　　不虛過一生；
translation: They are the same as those who take refuge in sentient beings and so forth, And do not lie beyond one lifetime.

source_sentence: 若僧伽二字，　　得到於舌上，
translation: If the two words saṃghâva are found on the tongue,

source_sentence: 同彼歸命等，　　不虛過一生。」
translation: They're the same as those who return to life and so forth, not falsely passing away in a single lifetime.

source_sentence: 「佛法僧名若不知，　　彼人最下故不獲，
translation: If someone doesn’t know the names of buddhas, Dharma, and saṃgha, they won’t get them because they’re the lowest.

source_sentence: 輪迴宛轉而久處，　　如迦尸花住虛空。」
translation: It's like the Kāśi flower that lives in space when it turns around and remains there for a long time.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊說伽陀曰：又說偈言：佛說是經已，諸苾芻眾，天帝釋等，一切大眾，
translation: It was then that the World-honored One uttered these verses: Having taught this sutra, the Buddha said in verse: All the bhikṣus, devas, nāgas, pratyekabuddhas, and other bodhisattvas of great assembly.

source_sentence: 歡喜信受，作禮而退。
translation: They rejoiced and believed it, bowed their heads in respect, and withdrew.

source_sentence: 佛說嗟襪曩法天子受三歸獲免惡道經
translation: Foshuo xianzang fatianzi undergoing the three refuges and getting freed from the evil destinies
